title: Introduction to Flutter App Development
introduction: Flutter is an open-source UI framework by Google used for building natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop from a single codebase.
details: Flutter provides a rich set of pre-designed widgets, expressive UI components, and a hot reload feature that allows developers to see changes instantly. It uses the Dart programming language and is widely adopted for cross-platform mobile app development. Learning Flutter involves understanding widgets, navigation, state management, and platform-specific integrations.
